headline: Uber Stock Tumbles On Earnings Miss, Weak Profit Guidance
summary: Uber Technologies stock fell early Wednesday after the ride-hail and food-delivery giant reported mixed fourth-quarter results, with earnings below expectations. Uber said that it earned 71 cents per share on an adjusted basis for the December-ended quarter, well below the 85 cents per share that analysts polled by FactSet were forecasting.

headline: Uber (NYSE:UBER) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates But Stock Drops
summary: Ride sharing and on-demand delivery platform Uber (NYSE:UBER) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 20.1% year on year to $14.37 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.71 per share was 11% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Uber (NYSE:UBER) Posts Q4 CY2025 Sales In Line With Estimates But Stock Drops
content.summary: Ride sharing and on-demand delivery platform Uber (NYSE:UBER) met Wall Streets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 20.1% year on year to $14.37 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.71 per share was 11% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Uber forecasts profit below estimates on cheaper rides and higher taxes
summary: Uber Technologies forecast first-quarter profit below expectations and fourth-quarter estimates on Wednesday, weighed down by higher taxes and an increase in more affordable ride options aimed to ​boost bookings.  "Our ETR reflects our business with operations across 70+ ‌countries, which results in a tax profile comparable to large US multinationals with significant global operating presence," Uber said.  Trips rose 22% in the fourth quarter, as more consumers opted for Uber's affordable offers such as shared rides and other lower-cost mobility products.

content.title: Uber forecasts profit below estimates on cheaper rides and higher taxes
content.summary: Uber Technologies forecast first-quarter profit below expectations and fourth-quarter estimates on Wednesday, weighed down by higher taxes and an increase in more affordable ride options aimed to ​boost bookings.  "Our ETR reflects our business with operations across 70+ ‌countries, which results in a tax profile comparable to large US multinationals with significant global operating presence," Uber said.  Trips rose 22% in the fourth quarter, as more consumers opted for Uber's affordable offers such as shared rides and other lower-cost mobility products.

headline: Uber Stock Wavers As Profit Guidance Miss Overshadows Strong Growth
summary: Uber Technologies stock wavered early Wednesday after the ride-hail and food-delivery giant reported mixed fourth-quarter results and offered profit guidance below expectations.  Uber said that it earned 71 cents per share on an adjusted basis for the December-ended quarter, up 27% year-over-year but below the 85 cents per share that analysts polled by FactSet were forecasting.  Meanwhile, Uber's gross bookings grew 22% to $54.14 billion, ahead of estimates of $53.14 billion.

content.title: Uber Stock Wavers As Profit Guidance Miss Overshadows Strong Growth
content.summary: Uber Technologies stock wavered early Wednesday after the ride-hail and food-delivery giant reported mixed fourth-quarter results and offered profit guidance below expectations.  Uber said that it earned 71 cents per share on an adjusted basis for the December-ended quarter, up 27% year-over-year but below the 85 cents per share that analysts polled by FactSet were forecasting.  Meanwhile, Uber's gross bookings grew 22% to $54.14 billion, ahead of estimates of $53.14 billion.

headline: General Motors Rebalances Robotaxis Layoffs And EV Plans For Future Returns
summary: Cruise, General Motors' autonomous vehicle unit, is preparing to launch paid robotaxi rides on Uber's platform, marking a new phase for GM's mobility efforts. GM has announced major layoffs at its Oshawa truck plant in Canada, drawing scrutiny and reaction from the Canadian government. The company is adjusting its electric vehicle approach, including selling its stake in an Altium Cells plant and retooling the Orion Assembly facility back toward internal combustion engine...

headline: Uber pushes robotaxi plans even as cheaper rides, higher taxes dent profit
summary: Uber Technologies backed its capital-intensive, early-stage autonomous vehicle strategy on Wednesday even as its profit took a hit from its push for affordable rides and higher taxes, sending the ​shares of the ride-hailing company down 5%.  Uber, however, forecast first-quarter profit below expectations and missed the fourth-quarter estimates, while warning that it expects a higher effective tax rate of 22% to 25% in 2026 due to its operations in more than 70 countries.  Uber said robotaxis are likely to expand the mobility market rather than displace existing demand, as robotaxis add supply, improve reliability and lower prices, while increasing trip volumes.

content.title: Uber pushes robotaxi plans even as cheaper rides, higher taxes dent profit
content.summary: Uber Technologies backed its capital-intensive, early-stage autonomous vehicle strategy on Wednesday even as its profit took a hit from its push for affordable rides and higher taxes, sending the ​shares of the ride-hailing company down 5%.  Uber, however, forecast first-quarter profit below expectations and missed the fourth-quarter estimates, while warning that it expects a higher effective tax rate of 22% to 25% in 2026 due to its operations in more than 70 countries.  Uber said robotaxis are likely to expand the mobility market rather than displace existing demand, as robotaxis add supply, improve reliability and lower prices, while increasing trip volumes.

headline: Uber Balances China Return Cash Rides And CFO Shift For Growth
summary: Uber Technologies (NYSE:UBER) has re-entered Greater China by launching ride-hailing services in Macau, marking its first Asian market expansion in several years. The company is testing cash payments for rides in several major US cities, a first for Uber in its home market. Uber has also announced a change in its chief financial officer as it scales investment in autonomous vehicles and artificial intelligence platforms. Uber Technologies, trading around $77.93, has recorded a 30.7% change...
